channel.title: Pill May Be Able to Erase Bad Memories
channel.description:
Feb. 16) - Scientists have discovered a drug that could erase fearful memories in humans. The method, using existing blood pressure pills, could be useful for weakening or erasing bad memories in people with post-traumatic stress disorder, the researchers say. Unfortunately, other research has shown, bad memories stick better than good ones. Studies in animal models have shown that fearful memories sometimes change when recalled, a process known as reconsolidation, and that this reconsolidation stage is vulnerable to the blood pressure drugs, called beta-adrenergic receptor blockers. In the new study on humans, by Merel Kindt and colleagues at University of Amsterdam in The Netherlands, 60 subjects were taught to associate pictures of spiders with a mild shock, creating a fearful memory. Later, they were given either a beta-blocker called propranolol or a placebo. The group given propranolol had a greatly decreased fear response to the spider pictures 24 hours later, according to a synopsis of the work from the journal Nature Neuroscience. And the fear response did not return, suggesting that their fear memory was completely erased. Some ethicists see problems, question whether such treatments begin to alter what it means to be human. "An interesting complexity is the possibility that victims, say of violence, might wish to erase the painful memory and with it their ability to give evidence against assailants," said professor John Harris, an expert in biological ethics at the University of Manchester, in an article in the Daily Mail. "Similarly criminals and witnesses to crime may, under the guise of erasing a painful memory, render themselves unable to give evidence." Meantime, scientists are zeroing in on how fear grips the mind. In 2005, researchers found a fear-factor gene that helps distinguish between people who have no fear and those who are afraid of everything. And last fall, scientists discovered the glue that keeps fearful memories stuck in the brain, a protein called beta-catenin that helps long-term memories solidify. There's apparently a natural way to rid yourself of bad memories, too. A 2007 study involving brain scans found that test subjects had the ability to suppress specific memories at a particular moment in time through repeated practice.
Source: [url=http://news.aol.com/health/article/pill-erases-bad-memories/345362]http://news.aol.com/health/article/pill-erases-bad-memories/345362[/url] Welcome to a new generation of OD.

item.title: Pill May Be Able to Erase Bad Memories
item.dc:creator: @Greg_the_Xeno Greg the Xeno
item.description:
@Greg_the_Xeno wrote:

R.I.P RSC:

You need bad memories to prevent you from having a similar event that caused that bad memory.

Or to turn you into a psychopath or a sociopath but who wants to get rid of them right?

Read full topic
item.source: Pill May Be Able to Erase Bad Memories

item.title: Pill May Be Able to Erase Bad Memories
item.dc:creator: @R.I.P_RSC R.I.P RSC
item.description:
@R.I.P_RSC wrote:

jme:

Sanga I agree. But it would be up to the person if they want to take it or not. Some people have a very bad quality of life, some people can’t even sleep because of traumatic events. If they want to take it, I have no objections as it doesn’t concern me.

In those cases they should get these pills. But they should be reminded that they have to be aware for the situations that they don’t remember anymore.

Read full topic
item.source: Pill May Be Able to Erase Bad Memories

item.title: Pill May Be Able to Erase Bad Memories
item.dc:creator: @sanga282 sanga282
item.description:
@sanga282 wrote:

srt8:

I think this would be a wonderful thing! Some people have had really bad things happen in their lives and it’s hard to overcome.

bad memories as much as good memories are what makes a person human you cant erase half of peoples life, bad memories can be as valuable as good memories whether you conciously know it or not. It allows a learning platform to continue your life and not fall into the same trap. If you forget then you may be subject to the same memory again. And if science has taugh us anything the human body is a miracle machine. This pill is unlikely to permanently remove the memories just heavely suppress them, if the same thing happens again it could come back twice as worse as the first time.

Read full topic
item.source: Pill May Be Able to Erase Bad Memories

item.title: Pill May Be Able to Erase Bad Memories
item.dc:creator: @R.I.P_RSC R.I.P RSC
item.description:
@R.I.P_RSC wrote:

Frostie21:

Because,surely some teenagers would resort to taking those in hopes of “forgetting their miserable lives” than committing suicide?

Suicide is the ultimate attention acquiring technique: Too bad you are dead and won’t notice it.

Read full topic

item.title: Pill May Be Able to Erase Bad Memories
item.dc:creator: @Frostie21 Frostie21
item.description:
@Frostie21 wrote:

What happens if you take a ton of them?

Because,surely some teenagers would resort to taking those in hopes of “forgetting their miserable lives” than committing suicide?

item.title: Pill May Be Able to Erase Bad Memories
item.dc:creator: @pesky pesky
item.description:
@pesky wrote:

[quote=“goatee, post:7, topic:262718”]^^ STFU.

I really don’t think the best thing to do is to forget bad memories. They make you who you are and erasing them is like erasing a part of you. People should be confronting fears, not running away or ignoring them.[/quote]

Thats what they said on the news the other day, like word for word near enough lmao

Read full topic

item.title: Pill May Be Able to Erase Bad Memories
item.dc:creator: @goatee goatee
item.description:
@goatee wrote:

^^ STFU.

I really don’t think the best thing to do is to forget bad memories. They make you who you are and erasing them is like erasing a part of you. People should be confronting fears, not running away or ignoring them.

Read full topic
